title: Wow
review: This is an amazing spiritual center. Loved reading about the temple and how it is the first and oldest temple of Rishikesh and that the town gets its name from it. Must visit.

title: very old temple
review: one more good historical  temple in rishikesh.  a must visit place if you are history lover. this is bharat mata temple. bharat is our country name and mata is mother.

title: For an understanding of India's glorious past  this is the place to be in..
review: This is a tall 8-storey temple with shining white body . Each storey has different themes dedicated to several legends , freedom fighters, deities, famous women, politicians  and preachers This is basically a Hindu temple dedicated to Goddess symbolizing India as a huge undivided country. A similar temple, although much smaller in size and limited to just one storey, exists in Varanasi . You can  go up to the 7th storey via a lift, but as we noticed a long queue in front of it , we decided to take the stairs , upto the 5th storey . A visit to the Remple to properly understand India's glorious past is highly recommended.

title: good bharat mata temple
review: it is very old temple in rishikesh. a must visit place if you want to see historical place.it has 8 floors and on every floor has different god statue. but mainly it is bharat mata mandir.

title: Dedicated to Mother India ....
review: Our travels brought us to the historical temple, which has provided us with a better understanding of the cultural history.  India is represented as a female Goddess, also know as Mother India, where she is worshipped here.  The temple is eight stories high, with an statute of Mother India inside the temple.  Photographs of other well known men and women of India adorn the walls on different levels of the temple.

title: peaceful
review: one of the famous temples in rishikesh and visited by tourists and pilgrims alike.clean and serene inside.

title: One of the oldest temple in rishikesh
review: Bharat mandir is one of the ancient temple of india.

title: It was one of the Finest Visit
review: Enjoyed my recent visit of Bharat Mandir it huge Temple with Indian architecture of new era.  Peaceful place to spending your day

title: Amazing place
review: we had the most blissful experience in this monastery, not to miss the little museum inside! i love the back side carvings on the wall.. we sat and meditated also after circling the building. i love just this place and love that huge tree!

title: Beautiful Temple
review: Rishikesh gets its name from this temple of Hrishikesh Narayan. Felt complete peace here and also loved reading about its history

title: Oldest Temple Here
review: One of the oldest temples in Rishikesh we visited in the late afternoon.  Do not miss the museum right off to the side at the entrance.

title: Must Visit
review: Thank you Mr. Chauhan for suggesting us to visit this temple at Rishikesh and also for sending Govind ji with us. One of the oldest temple I have seen anywhere in India. Good experience and historical.

title: nice museum and temple
review: ancient temple i guess the oldest one in rishikesh. lot of history and interesting facts that i got to know. my children enjoyed the museum here.

title: A nice quite place.
review: Its a historical temple and having a guide makes it more interesting. It has nice artifacts to see and know about.

title: Only one temple in india of Bharat Mata
review: I went to this place it is awesome there are total 7 to 8 floor and on each floor you will find different different stories of bhakt, shahid, god, goddess, and many more. Once must visit kind of temple.

title: Temple dedicated to Mother India
review: This is an altogether different temple dedicated to our country India. Our country is personified as a female Goddess - Mother India and worshiped here. It's an eight storeyed structure. There is an idol of Mother India in the temple. Photographs of several great men and women of the nation and freedom fighters are seen on other floors. This place is worth a visit as it is the only temple dedicated to Mother India.

title: Powerful
review: Sit and meditate and quiet down in front of this sculpture. Many "yoga" tourist will overlook this so be glad it came your way.

title: A Surprise amidst the bustle of Rishikesh
review: This beautiful and very ancient temple is an oasis of calm near to the Triveni Ghat shopping area.   Easy to find on Google Maps and a good place to just contemplate away from the hustle and bustle but near enough to do some shopping in the same trip if you wish.

title: Loved it
review: This temple is dedicated to our motherland.  we climbed all the floors and really loved it.  many people visit and enjoy.

title: this place has a great histry
review: This place would be good for those people who are interested in spirituality as well as in history. i had a good time here

title: Very small temple but worth a visit if you're nearby
review: This temple is very small, it takes about 20 minutes to see it all. It is pretty, however, and not far from Triveni Ghat.

title: Worht a visit
review: the temple is beautiful with great art. it is one of the older temples in rishikesh. worth a visit. recommend.

title: Best temple in Rishikesh
review: Don't miss this one. Very historic, one of the oldest Temples. Excellent museum next to the temple. The murti is well preserved.

title: Good campus, spiritual feeling
review: Rishikesh is known for its spiritual offerings. This is one of them. Enter here from one of the two gates and a huge arcade welcomes you. Visit the temple, make a parikrama and see different stages of lives of Lord Krishna. A good feeling.

title: Must Visit
review: Initially I thought this temple was of Bharat - the brother of Lord Rama but realised I was wrong! This centuries old shrine is the place on which the town of Rishikesh gets its name and is the temple of Lord Hrishikesh Narayan who is also known is Bharat Bhagwan here. First temple of Rishikesh and a must visit in every itinerary.

title: Interesting History and Faith
review: This is a nice place to find peace and also see beautiful ancient architecture. The museum attached to this temple is also very interesting.

title: Holy & Divine, A Must visit
review: Can't miss on this old & historic temple on your visit to Rishikesh. I heard that this temple is almost 1000 years old.

title: Shri Bharat Mandir
review: This is the oldest temple in Rishikesh and dedicated to Lord Vishnu, located near Triveni Ghat and Chandrabhaga Bridge. The temple is very important mainly for two reasons. First reason, is the city gets its name from this temple and another reason is Adi Guru Shankaracharya (Born – 788 AD – Died – 820) rebuilt the temple at the beginning of 9th century.  Inside the temple compound, there is a small museum and you can see some idols from the 2nd century to the 14th century. There is no charge for the museum for a visit but photography is prohibited inside the museum as well as in the temple.

title: Historically important and interesting
review: Loved the museum attached to this temple, very well kept and interesting. A must visit for anyone coming to Rishieksh

title: Interesting place
review: Visited this temple for the first time and thought it was dedicated to Lord Ram's brother Bharat but I got to know that it is actually an ancient Vishnu temple

title: Temple of God Vishnu
review: This temple of God Vishnu Temple. We feel wonderful experience in this temple. If you vist Rishikesh must see Bharat Mandir.

title: Religious importance
review: Temple of Lord Vishnu, this place is a popular religious place. However, we were not impressed by the upkeep of place - too many shops and poor maintenance. The administration needs to spruce up the place.

title: Peaceful temple
review: This is multi-story temple.. said to be the oldest temple in Rishikesh. It is very calm but some parts of building is rented to shopkeepers.

title: Bharat Mandir – Good Temple And Museum
review: We opted to visit this place during this summer holidays the weather is nice. This temple belongs to the Lord Hrishikesh Narayan not Lord Rama actually. Maybe that is the reason that this place is called Rishikesh. It is a good place for devotees and calm and serene for meditation purposes.

title: The temple which gives Rishikesh its name
review: I was deeply intrigued to know that Bharat Mandir is dedicated to Lord Hrishikesh Narayan, an incarnation of Lord Vishnu (and not related to Bharat of Ramayana or Bharat as in India); the town of Rishikesh gets its identity from the deity of this temple. Must visit for every Rishikesh lover.

title: An Old Temple Not to be missed
review: The name is  misnomer. It is dedicated to Vishnu and not to Bharath.The name for the City of Rishikesh has irs origin here.The temple is well maintaines. Take time to visit the museum also which is worth visiting.

title: Bharat Mandir Musium
review: God n Goddess showcase with India founders . History lession nothing much of it . Its good for children to know more of God and Goddess provided you know them . Otherwise there is no description of them , just their name .

title: A quick glimpse of India
review: Efforts has been taken to represent Ancient and Modern India by dedicating floors to one conncept each. There are 7-8 floors and there is lift service which takes you to the top floor and you can walk down visting each floor when you do. This is one of the things you cover when you are on Haridwar local sight seeing trip

title: Temple of Presiding God of Rishikesh.
review: Bharat Bhagwan is presiding God of Rishikesh. This temple is in the middle of Rishikesh market. It's an old temple with spiritual and historic value. Not to be missed.

title: The place that gave Rishikesh town its name!
review: Before visiting this place during my holiday with friends a few days back I got to know for the first time that this revered shrine is not of Lord Rama's younger Bharat neither of the King Bharat but of Lord Hrishikesh Narayan Bharat ji who is an incarnation of Lord Vishnu. Very interesting and pious place for those interested in religions and spirituality. The museum there is also very nice.

title: Historic
review: Also known as Rishikesh narayan mandir, oldest one in Rishikesh with small museum also. Old structure with religious value.On occasion of Akshaya Tritiya , its believed that having 108 rounds of temple equals to Badrinath Temple visit

title: Must Visit!
review: Had the divine experience while visiting Hrishikesh Narain Temple. Must visit since this temple gave name to Rishikesh. Nice museum as well.

title: lord Vishnu's Ancient Temple Plus a must see Museum
review: This temple of lord vishnu's Kalyug form known as Bharat is a symbolization of eeshwar of Risheek (senses).. Thus the name of Rishikesh.   This is an ancient temple and to me an my family it was a real peaceful experience to be here two days ago.

title: PEACEFULL
review: a well organized place & notably clean & welcoming. The pundits were wellversed with whatever they were doing.

title: Multi storie Temple
review: Bharat Mandir is at the end when you cross river gange from west side of rishikesh. Almost all hindu Devi and Devta are established in each floor BUT SAD THINGS IS THAT THERE ARE SHOPS ALLOTED ON RENTAL ON MOST FLOORS.

title: It is one of the oldest temples in Rishikesh.
review: It gives one a peaceful sense of belonging and solace. I found it so good to be there to spend a few minutes in silence and say a prayer.
